ArticleTitle.sentence: Large-scale identification and characterization of human genes that activate NF-kappaB and MAPK signaling pathways.

event.clue: Large-scale identification and characterization of human genes that activate NF-kappaB and MAPK signaling pathways.

AbstractText.sentence: We have carried out a large-scale identification and characterization of human genes that activate the NF-kappaB and MARK signaling pathways.

event.clue: We have carried out a large-scale identification and characterization of human genes that activate the NF-kappaB and MARK signaling pathways.

AbstractText.sentence: We constructed full-length cDNA libraries using the oligo-capping method and prepared an arrayed cDNA pool consisting of 150 000 cDNAs randomly isolated from the libraries.

For analysis of the NF-kappaB signaling pathway, we introduced each of the cDNAs into human embryonic kidney 293 cells and examined whether it activated the transcription of a luciferase reporter gene driven by a promoter containing the consensus NF-kappaB binding sites.

event.clue: For analysis of the NF-kappaB signaling pathway, we introduced each of the cDNAs into human embryonic kidney 293 cells and examined whether it activated the transcription of a luciferase reporter gene driven by a promoter containing the consensus NF-kappaB binding sites.

For analysis of the NF-kappaB signaling pathway, we introduced each of the cDNAs into human embryonic kidney 293 cells and examined whether it activated the transcription of a luciferase reporter gene driven by a promoter containing the consensus NF-kappaB binding sites.

AbstractText.sentence: In total, we identified 299 cDNAs that activate the NF-kappaB pathway, and we classified them into 83 genes, including 30 characterized activator genes of the NF-kappaB pathway, 28 genes whose involvement in the NF-kappaB pathways have not been characterized and 25 novel genes.

event.clue: In total, we identified 299 cDNAs that activate the NF-kappaB pathway, and we classified them into 83 genes, including 30 characterized activator genes of the NF-kappaB pathway, 28 genes whose involvement in the NF-kappaB pathways have not been characterized and 25 novel genes.

AbstractText.sentence: We then carried out a similar analysis for the identification of genes that activate the MARK pathway, utilizing the same cDNA resource.

event.clue: We then carried out a similar analysis for the identification of genes that activate the MARK pathway, utilizing the same cDNA resource.

AbstractText.sentence: We assayed 145 000 cDNAs and identified 57 genes that activate the MARK pathway.

event.clue: We assayed 145 000 cDNAs and identified 57 genes that activate the MARK pathway.

AbstractText.sentence: Interestingly, 27 genes were overlapping between the NF-kappaB and the MAPK pathways, which may indicate that these genes play cross-talking roles between these two pathways.
